image_1.description: DS true positive data refers to correctly labeled positive instances in the dataset, which the DSGAN framework aims to identify and preserve.
DS false positive data refers to instances in the dataset that are incorrectly labeled as positive, a key issue addressed by the DSGAN framework.
DS negative data refers to the dataset that is filtered to redistribute false positive instances, providing a cleaned dataset for relation classification.

image_1.merged_entity_name: THE DECISION BOUNDARY OF DS DATA
image_1.description: The decision boundary of DS data is the threshold that separates true positive samples from false positive samples in the distant supervision dataset, which is a focus in improving the performance of relation extraction.
source_image_entities: THE DECISION BOUNDARY OF DS DATA

image_1.description: The desired decision boundary is the optimal threshold that maximizes the separation between true positive and false positive samples in the distant supervision dataset, which is achieved through the adversarial learning process in DSGAN.

image_2.description: The DS positive dataset is a collection of samples used for training the generator and discriminator within the DSGAN system, containing positive examples for training the models and aiming to collapse the discriminator through overfitting.

The Generator is a component of the DSGAN system, responsible for producing a set of probability distribution over a bag of DS positive samples and sampling sentences based on that distribution, aiming to fool the discriminator into classifying these samples as real.

The process of selecting samples from the output of the generator, categorizing them into high-confidence and low-confidence samples based on their probability scores, and sampling according to the probability distribution in the discrete GANs.

The Discriminator is a component of the DSGAN system, tasked with distinguishing between high-confidence and low-confidence samples generated by the Generator, and providing feedback to the generator to improve its performance.

The initial phase of training where the discriminator is trained using both positive and negative datasets before it interacts with the generator, with pre-trained models on datasets (P, N^G) and (P, N^D) respectively.

image_3.entity_name: CNN WINDOW C_W, KERNEL SIZE C_K
image_3.description: The CNN window size (c_w) is set to 3 and the kernel size (c_k) is set to 100, used in the generator and discriminator models of the DSGAN method.
source_image_entities: CNN WINDOW C_W, KERNEL SIZE C_K

image_3.description: The word embedding dimension (D_E) is set to 50 and the vocabulary size (|V|) is 114042, used in the generator and discriminator models of the DSGAN method.
The position embedding dimension (D_P) is set to 5, used in the generator and discriminator models of the DSGAN method.
The learning rate for the generator (G) is set to 1e-5 and for the discriminator (D) it is set to 1e-4, used in the adversarial learning process of the DSGAN method.

image_4.description: /business/person/company is one of the relation types used as an example in the training process of DSGAN, representing a context of business, person, and company.
/people/person/place lived is another relation type from the people class of Reidel dataset used in the training process, representing a context of people, person, and place lived.
/location/neighborhood/neighborhood of is a relation type from the location class used to illustrate the training process, representing a context of location, neighborhood, and neighborhood of.
DSGAN refers to a robust adversarial learning strategy used for distant supervision relation extraction, represented by red squares in the graphs.
The Generator is a component in the adversarial learning process, designed to generate true positive samples for a relation type, represented by blue circles in the graphs.

image_5.description: DSGAN is a robust adversarial learning strategy used for distant supervision relation extraction, aiming to detect true positive samples from a noisy distant supervision dataset.
/business/person/company is one of the relation types used as an example in the training process of DSGAN, representing the accuracy trend for business/person/company category.
/people/person/place lived is another relation type from the people class of Reidel dataset used in the training process, representing the accuracy trend for people/person/place_lived category.

/location/neighborhood/neighborhood of is a relation type from the location class used to illustrate the training process, representing the accuracy trend for location/neighborhood/neighborhood_of category.

image_6.description: DSGAN is a robust adversarial learning strategy used for distant supervision relation extraction, which aims to detect true positive samples from a noisy distant supervision dataset. It is a model-agnostic approach that involves a generator to produce true positives and a discriminator to classify positive and negative data samples, with the goal of decreasing the discriminator's performance while improving the generator's performance for predicting true positives.

The precision-recall curve is a graphical representation used to evaluate the performance of different models in terms of precision and recall. It displays the trade-off between precision and recall for the models CNN+ONE, CNN+ONE+DSGAN, CNN+ATT, and CNN+ATT+DSGAN. The x-axis represents recall, and the y-axis represents precision, providing an intuitive display of the trend of accuracy for these models.

image_7.description: DSGAN is a robust adversarial learning strategy used for distant supervision relation extraction, which aims to detect true positive samples from a noisy distant supervision dataset. It is a method proposed in the paper for this purpose.

Graph displaying the precision-recall trade-off for four different models: PCNN+ONE, PCNN+ONE+DSGAN, PCNN+ATT, and PCNN+ATT+DSGAN, which are used to evaluate the performance of the generator in the adversarial learning process. The x-axis represents recall, and the y-axis represents precision.

image_8.description: DSGAN is a generative adversarial network designed to improve the performance of relation extraction models, used for detecting true positive samples from a noisy distant supervision dataset, and is a robust adversarial learning strategy for distant supervision relation extraction.

CNN+ONE is a model that combines Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) with a one-hot encoding scheme, and is one of the recent state-of-the-art models used in the comparison to observe the improvement brought by the redistributed dataset.

CNN+ATT is a model that combines Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) with an attention mechanism, and is another state-of-the-art model used in the comparison to evaluate the performance improvement after applying the redistributed dataset.

PCNN+ONE is a model that combines Position-aware Convolutional Neural Network (PCNN) with a one-hot encoding scheme, and is one of the models used in the comparison to assess the effectiveness of the redistributed dataset on improving distant supervision relation extraction.

PCNN+ATT is a model that combines Position-aware Convolutional Neural Network (PCNN) with an attention mechanism, and is included in the comparison to determine the impact of the redistributed dataset on the performance of distant supervision relation extraction.
